message.content:
I got this message after installing `entire cli` tool: Warning: Husky detected (.husky/)

  Husky may overwrite hooks installed by Entire on npm install.
  To make Entire hooks permanent, add these lines to your Husky hook files:

    .husky/prepare-commit-msg:
      entire hooks git prepare-commit-msg "$1" "$2" 2>/dev/null || true

    .husky/commit-msg:
      entire hooks git commit-msg "$1" || exit 1

    .husky/post-commit:
      entire hooks git post-commit 2>/dev/null || true

    .husky/pre-push:
      entire hooks git pre-push "$1" || true

content.thinking: The user wants to integrate the `entire` CLI tool's hooks with their existing Husky setup. Let me check what Husky hooks already exist in the project.

content.text: Let me check the current Husky hook files in the project.

content.content:
1→#!/usr/bin/env sh
     2→
     3→# Auto-fix changed files and stage them
     4→npx --no-install lint-staged
     5→
     6→# Validate everything
     7→npm test
     8→

file.content:
#!/usr/bin/env sh

# Auto-fix changed files and stage them
npx --no-install lint-staged

# Validate everything
npm test

content.text: Only a `pre-commit` hook exists. The hooks mentioned in the warning (`prepare-commit-msg`, `commit-msg`, `post-commit`, `pre-push`) don't exist yet, so I'll create them. The `pre-commit` hook doesn't need changes since `entire` doesn't require a `pre-commit` hook.

input.content:
#!/usr/bin/env sh

entire hooks git prepare-commit-msg "$1" "$2" 2>/dev/null || true

#!/usr/bin/env sh

entire hooks git commit-msg "$1" || exit 1

#!/usr/bin/env sh

entire hooks git post-commit 2>/dev/null || true

#!/usr/bin/env sh

entire hooks git pre-push "$1" || true

toolUseResult.content:
#!/usr/bin/env sh

entire hooks git prepare-commit-msg "$1" "$2" 2>/dev/null || true

#!/usr/bin/env sh

entire hooks git commit-msg "$1" || exit 1

#!/usr/bin/env sh

entire hooks git post-commit 2>/dev/null || true

#!/usr/bin/env sh

entire hooks git pre-push "$1" || true

input.description: Make all new hook files executable

content.text:
Done. Created 4 new Husky hook files with the `entire` CLI integrations:

- `.husky/prepare-commit-msg` — snapshots context before commit
- `.husky/commit-msg` — validates the commit message
- `.husky/post-commit` — runs after commit completes
- `.husky/pre-push` — runs before push

The existing `.husky/pre-commit` hook (lint-staged + tests) was left unchanged since `entire` doesn't need a `pre-commit` hook.
Let me check the current state of the repository.

content.thinking:
Let me analyze the changes:

1. `.entire/.gitignore` - new file for entire CLI
2. `.entire/settings.json` - entire CLI settings (staged version has strategy + enabled, unstaged adds telemetry)
3. `.gitignore` - changed `.cursor` to `.idea` in the AI assistant files section
4. `.husky/commit-msg`, `.husky/post-commit`, `.husky/pre-push`, `.husky/prepare-commit-msg` - new husky hooks for entire CLI

I should stage the unstaged change to `.entire/settings.json` as well, since the user said "commit everything".


Now I'll stage that remaining change and create the commit.

content.text: All changes are the Entire CLI setup and Husky hook integration. There's one unstaged change in `.entire/settings.json` (adds `telemetry: true`). I'll stage it and commit everything.

input.command:
git add .entire/settings.json .entire/.gitignore .gitignore .husky/commit-msg .husky/post-commit .husky/pre-push .husky/prepare-commit-msg && git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
Add Entire CLI setup and integrate hooks with Husky

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"
